identificationModule.briefTitle: Impact of rewarming rate on interleukin-6 levels in patients with shockable cardiac arrest receiving targeted temperature management at 33 째C
identificationModule.officialTitle: Impact of rewarming rate on interleukin-6 levels in patients with shockable cardiac arrest receiving targeted temperature management at 33 째C: the ISOCRATE pilot randomized controlled trial

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Investigator-initiated, blinded-outcome-assessor, parallel-group, two-arm, pragmatic, single-center, RCT. Patients were randomly allocated in a 1:1 ratio to either a 0.25 째C/h or 0.50 째C/h rewarming rate, using a web-based system accessible 24 h a day. The randomization sequence was generated with permuted blocks of varying sizes and without stratification.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Blinding of the staff providing patient care was not feasible. However, the psychologist who assessed the day-90 outcomes in all patients was blinded to group assignment.
